vii. “Portfolio” shall refer to the mutual fund investments of the Customers with respect to which Bank Of Baroda is acting as distributor.
viii. “linked Accounts” refers to Bank Of Baroda savings/ current accounts of the Customer held with Bank Of Baroda linked with his/her CIF id used for registration on Portal.

II APPLICABILITY OF TERMS AND CONDITIONS

i. These terms form the contract between the customer/s and Bank Of Baroda for Investment account opening and availing online investment services through this platform. For availing services, customer shall be required to register on the platform and agree to these Terms and the Risk Profiler Terms. In order to successfully avail the services offered and transact through this platform, the customer/s shall have to read and agree to the Order Confirmation Terms separately at the end of the concerned transaction. Bank Of Baroda shall be entitled at its sole discretion to accept or reject such registration and/or transaction requests of the customer/s and its decision in this regard shall be final and binding. By using this platform for availing services, the customer/s acknowledges and accepts these Terms.
III AUTHORIZATION

i. The Customer hereby appoints Bank Of Baroda as his/her agent to *transact i.e. purchase, switch and redeem units of mutual funds on his/her behalf, as may be instructed by the Customer from time to time, on the terms and conditions mentioned herein. The Customer agrees that Bank Of Baroda may at its sole discretion vary the terms and conditions or withdraw any of the facilities provided herein from time to time.
ii. The Customer shall irrevocably authorise Bank Of Baroda to execute his/her instructions with regards to purchase switch or redemption of the units.

iii. *Transaction rights will be pursuant to the customer executing and granting a mandate in favour of Bank Of Baroda, in the manner and form as prescribed by Bank Of Baroda from time to time. A mandate will be applicable to all Investment Accounts whether presently existing or to be opened in future. These terms and conditions set out the rights and obligations of you, the User and / or customer, and us, the Bank, in connection with your use of the Services and/or Facilities.
III PURCHASE / SALE

i. Transaction instructions only from Registered Customers of Bank Of Baroda Portal Platform would be processed. Registered customers can only Purchase, Redeem and Switch Mutual Fund units through this service.
ii. There may be an Exit Load in Mutual Fund schemes, which are mentioned in the offer document. Please check the same before investing.

iii. Investments from residents in the United States of America and Canada are not permitted in certain mutual funds. Bank Of Baroda shall not be liable for rejections of such applications by Mutual Funds, where investor is an US and Canada resident.
iv. Purchase instructions shall be processed only after funds sufficient to cover the purchase price and other costs and charges have been received by Bank Of Baroda.

v. If for any reasons Bank Of Baroda is unable to purchase or redeem the full quantity of units such as instructed by the Customer, Bank Of Baroda shall be entitled at its discretion and the Customer shall irrevocably authorised Bank Of Baroda to purchase or sell (as the case may be) a lesser quantity of units/securities. Bank Of Baroda shall not be responsible for the non-execution of the Customer’s instruction for the entire quantity or the remaining quantity.

vi. If after execution of any transaction it is for any reason found that Bank Of Baroda has not been put in sufficient funds, the Customer shall pay the deficient amount to Bank Of Baroda forthwith on demand failing which Bank Of Baroda may (but shall not be bound to) square up the transaction at any time at the Customer’s sole risk and cost. Any loss on such squaring up will be borne solely by the Customer and he/she will pay to Bank Of Baroda the additional amount that may be payable by the Customer, Bank Of Baroda's demand being conclusive.

vii. The Customer shall agree and acknowledge that the facility provided herein is presently available in respect of select Mutual Funds only with whom Bank Of Baroda has entered into a separate arrangement.

viii. The Customer shall agree and acknowledge that any instruction given or purported to be given by him/her before the cut off time as may be intimated by Bank Of Baroda to the Customer from time to time, would be processed on the same day. Any instructions received after the prescribed cut off time will be processed on the next working day.

ix. The Customer shall acknowledge that the units of the schemes shall be allotted, redeemed or switched, at the Applicable Net Asset Value (NAV)** on the date of the transaction, if the application for purchase, redemption or switch is received by the Mutual Fund before the cut-off time as specified by Bank Of Baroda and consistent with the terms of the Scheme. However Bank Of Baroda shall not be liable for any loss that may arise to the Customer as a result of the incorrect NAV applied on units allotted to the Customer by the Mutual Fund.

x. The Customer shall acknowledge that any transaction request falling due on a holiday would be processed on the next business day and respective NAV would be applicable as per the Mutual Fund's offer document. The shall also acknowledge that transactions once placed can be cancelled, provided the cancellation is initiated on the same day, and prior to the cut off time.
x. III REGISTRATION & RISK PROFILING
i. The customers who are not registered for Bank Of Baroda WMS platform, shall not be allowed to attempt any transaction until they obtain registration for Bank Of Baroda WMS.

ii. Only the KYC Registration Agency (KRA) verified investors get transaction rights on Bank Of Baroda WMS Platform. Accordingly while registering for the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform, the Customer’s KYC status will be verified though SEBI approved KYC Registration Agency (KRA Agency). The Customer hereby agrees and authorizes Bank Of Baroda to check their KYC status by sharing the PAN No. with the KRA Agency.

iii. If the Customer KYC/ Online registration is required to be done at the KRA Agency and/ or RTAs, the Customer’s KYC details available with Bank Of Baroda shall be used to complete for the registration(s). The Customers shall agree and authorise Bank Of Baroda to submit the Bank’s KYC Documents (Account No., Mode of Operation, Branch, Permanent Address, Correspondence Address, Name, Pan, DOB, Photograph, and signature)/ investor related documents with the KYC Agency and/or RTA for the purpose of validation, registration and to comply with regulatory requirement notified from time to time.

iv. Once the process of online registration is completed, which includes success confirmation from Know Your Client Registration Agency “KRA”, customer is allowed to initiate a transaction. Once the success confirmation is received from the Registrar & Transfer Agent “RTA”, the order will be executed on that day’s (day of successful confirmation from RTA) NAV. In case RTA reject the request, that order will be cancelled & Customer will be informed via Email/SMS.

v. The Customers, who are registered for Bank Of Baroda WMS, shall be able to view all the features available on the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform and shall also be allowed to use all the functionalities of the platform.
• Power packed features to help you create wealth!
vi. The Customers who already have their portfolio with Bank Of Baroda, their portfolio shall automatically be imported to this platform for convenience of the Customers.

vii. The customers who don’t already have their portfolio with Bank Of Baroda and customers who have their portfolio with Bank Of Baroda but have not undergone risk profiling shall have to undergo risk profiling and agree to the applicable terms and conditions. In the aforesaid case, the Customer shall be taken to the risk profiling questionnaire page to complete the same.
viii. Basis the result of the risk profiler, the final ‘Risk Profile’ of the Customers, and the suggested model asset allocation shall be displayed on the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform.
• Power packed features to help you create wealth!

ix. The suggested model asset allocation is indicative and shall not constitute or be deemed to constitute legal, tax, securities or investment advice, or opinion regarding the appropriateness of any investment, or a solicitation for any product or service. The information provided is merely for general understanding and reference. The customer needs to verify all the facts, law and contents with the text of the prevailing statutes and seek appropriate professional advice before acting on the basis of any information displayed on the platform as the taxation implications may vary depending upon the facts in each case/interpretation by tax authorities and since tax laws are subject to change from time to time. Bank Of Baroda expressly disclaims any liability to any person, in respect of anything done or omitted to be done by any such person by placing reliance upon the suggested model asset allocation. The use of information displayed on the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform is entirely at the recipient’s own risk. Bank Of Baroda does not accept any responsibility for any error whether caused by negligence or otherwise or for any losses or damage incurred by anyone in reliance on anything set out on the Bank Of Baroda WMS. The information set out on the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform may be subject to updation, completion, revision, verification and amendment and such information may change materially. Bank Of Baroda is acting merely as a distributor of third parties for mutual funds and will not be liable for any losses/damage incurred by Customer by putting reliance on the suggested allocation.

x. The customer hereby understands and agrees that the suggestion are based on data collected from a third party and Bank Of Baroda shall not be liable for any loss/damage suffered by the Customer by putting reliance on the same.

xi. The Customer acknowledges that by bringing the investment to the customer’s attention, Bank Of Baroda accepts no liability with respect to the accuracy or completeness of the information furnished to the Customer in respect thereof.

xii. The Customer agrees and acknowledges that notwithstanding the fact that Bank Of Baroda may have brought the investment to the attention of the Customer, all decisions to transact in the investments/mutual funds would be the Customer’s own based on his/her independent assessment of the risks associated with investing in the mutual funds and by undertaking all necessary investigations and obtaining legal, accounting, tax or other professional advice to the Customer’s satisfaction.
xiii. Customer will have an option of updating his/her risk profile by re-taking the risk profile questionnaire under the ‘Risk Profile’ section on Bank Of Baroda WMS.
IV SERVICES
The Bank Of Baroda WMS platform consists of the below mentioned sections:

i. Dashboard: This is the first section where the registered customer gets redirected to after login into Bank Of Baroda WMS. In this section the customers can view top level details of their portfolio such as Model asset allocation, Portfolio Performance, Product Allocation, Top Holdings and Last transactions. Detailed functionalities available in this section are as follows:
i. “Home Icon” – This icon allows Customers to go to the dashboard section of Bank Of Baroda WMS
ii. “Filter Icon”- This icon allows Customers to toggle between their online and offline portfolio
iii. “Transact Icon” – This icon allows Customers to go to the invest section.
iv. “Cart Icon” – This icon allows Customers to go to the Investment Cart and carry out multiple transactions by authenticating once.
v. “Notification Bell Icon” – This icon allows Customers to view system generated notifications and alerts.
vi. “User Icon” – This icon allows Customers to view their relationship manager’s name, email id and mobile number.
vii. “Hanburger Icon” – This icon allows Customers to navigate to the following sections:
i. “Dashboard” – This option allows Customers to go to the dashboard section of Bank Of Baroda WMS.

ii. “Portfolio Analytics” – This option allow Customers to navigate to the Portfolio Analytics section of Bank Of Baroda WMS where they can view the mutual fund portfolio that they have purchased through Bank Of Baroda.

iii. “Reports” – This option allows Customers to navigate to the report section of Bank Of Baroda WMS where they can view holdings, transactions, investment maturity, insurance, corporate action and realised gain/loss statement for their Bank Of Baroda portfolio.

iv. “Transact” – This option allows Customers to navigate to the Invest section of Bank Of Baroda WMS where they can carry out buy, systematic investment plans (SIP), switch, redemption, systematic transfer plans (STP), systematic withdrawal plans (SWP), stop SIP, Stop STP and stop SWP.

v. “Online Registration” – This option allows Customers to navigate to the Online Registration page of Bank Of Baroda WMS where they can initiate self-registration and get transaction access on Bank Of Baroda WMS.
vi. “Order Status” – This option allows Customers to navigate to Order Status section of Bank Of Baroda WMS where they can view status of their orders placed.

vii. “Risk Profiling” – This option allows Customers to navigate to the Risk Profile section of Bank Of Baroda WMS where they can view the details of their Risk Profile and re-take the risk assessment questionnaire.
V TRANSACTION AND ORDER CONFIRMATION
i. The order confirmation screen will display all the transaction that were present in the cart, as per the details entered by the Customer grouped as per transaction type.
ii. The Customer shall have to read and agree to the relevant terms and conditions applicable for confirming the transaction and successfully placing the order.

iii. The Customer understands that the purchase transactions can be carried out from any of the Linked Accounts, and the redemption proceeds and the dividends credits (if any) shall be deposited into the same account that was used for the purchase.

iv. Bank Of Baroda is not acting as the custodian of the Customer's portfolio of securities or funds or managing/administering/controlling the same in any manner whatsoever.

As a consequence of which, the investments in financial products are subject to a very high degree of risk and the associated returns cannot be predicted with absolute certainty. Before the Customer invests
in a product or service, he must understand carefully, and if required, with help of an expert independent

The Customer agrees and acknowledges that any loss, damage, liability caused or suffered by the Customer due to disclosure of any or all information of confidential nature shall be borne by him/her without transferring any liability or responsibility towards Bank Of Baroda.
ix. The Customer shall comply with such guidelines, instructions or terms as Bank Of Baroda may prescribe from time to time with respect to Bank Of Baroda WMS.
VIII JOINT ACCOUNTS
i. Joint accounts in 'Either Or Survivor' mode can be used to make purchases on Bank Of Baroda WMS platform.
ii. Access to Bank Of Baroda WMS platform will be made available within the Bank Of Baroda Mobile, Bank Of Baroda WMS website login of any of the holders to the account.

iii. For all transactions done through Bank Of Baroda WMS platform authentication by any of the holders of joint accounts in ‘Either Or Survivor’ mode will be considered valid and binding on the joint holders for processing transactions.
IX CHARGES AND FEES

i. All sales and purchases and all other acts done by the Bank for me pursuant to these terms and conditions shall be at my risk and cost and in consideration thereof, I agree to pay charges/fees as per the Bank's schedule of charges/fees. The schedule of charges is subject to change without prior notice and consent to such changes, which may be made in Future. I agree and understand that the Bank'charges/ fees are in addition to those levied by the mutual fund Company.

ii. The charges/fees shall be paid by me to the Bank on my giving instructions to the Bank. All fees, charges and reimbursement of expenditure shall be paid or made in full by me without any counter claim, set off or withholding. All our liabilities and obligations hereunder to the Bank shall be joint or several.

i. The Customer shall ensure that there are sufficient funds in the Linked Accounts for undertaking transactions through this Bank Of Baroda WMS platform and Bank Of Baroda shall not be liable for any consequences arising out of its failure to carry out the instructions due to inadequacy of funds and/or credit facilities. ii. The Customer expressly agrees and acknowledges that in the event he/she applies for Service(s) provided by Bank Of Baroda through this platform, he/she may do so, by submitting the required documents online in the manner specified by Bank Of Baroda, unless specifically required by Bank Of Baroda to be submitted in physical form only / also. Further, the Customer agrees and undertakes to sign such other documents as may be required by Bank Of Baroda from time to time in this regard.

The Customer irrevocably and unconditionally authorises Bank Of Baroda to access all his Linked Account(s) for effecting banking or other transactions performed by the Customer through the Bank Of Baroda platform. The instructions of the Customer shall be effected only when such instructions are in accordance with the prescribed procedure and applicable laws.

While Bank Of Baroda shall endeavor to carry out the instructions promptly, they shall not be responsible for any delay in carrying on the instructions due to any reason whatsoever, including due to failure of operational systems, technical issues or any requirement of law.

Bank Of Baroda is not acting in a fiduciary capacity when making available any of the products and services through the Bank Of Baroda WMS application, and accepts no liability nor responsibility whatsoever with respect to the use of the information and documents displayed on the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform.

Nothing contained herein shall constitute or be deemed to constitute an advice, invitation or solicitation to sell/purchase any products/services of Bank Of Baroda / third party and is not intended to create any rights and obligations. Bank Of Baroda shall not be responsible for any third party products, goods, services and offers.
vi. The Customer shall authorise Bank Of Baroda to do, perform or execute upon my express instructions and at my risk and cost, all or any of the following acts, deeds, matters and things:
i. To subscribe to the units of the mutual fund & securities on his /her behalf and to pay to the units/securities so purchased, on Cusstomer’ss instructions.
ii. To receive the account statement pertaining to the above units/securities and to acknowledge receipt of the same.

iii. To redeem /sell the units/securities held by the Customer (whether solely or jointly with others) and to receive the payment of the redemption/sale price and acknowledge receipt of the same, based on Customer’s instructions.
iv. To sign all such writings and do all such acts as may be required for redeeming any units/securities.

v. To collect, receive and give good effectual receipts and discharges for any sum including dividend, interest or income arising from the units/securities and to sign and endorse dividend and interest warrants.
vii. To collect and deposit monies in an account opened in the Customer’s name with the Bank and to make such debits in the said account as may be necessary.

viii. To give instructions and orders to brokers and agents including instructions and orders of sale, purchase ,transfer, splitting and consolidation of securities and to pay remuneration, brokerage, commissions and other sums to such brokers and agents.
ix. To correspond with and give notice to the mutual fund and corresponding asset management company on Customer’s behalf.
x. To instruct the mutual fund and/or the corresponding asset management company to make note of instructions with regards to nomination /changes in investment plan/any other changes.

i. All instructions for accessing the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform and/ or availment of Service(s) shall be given, through computer, mobile phones or any other medium/channel enabled by Bank Of Baroda for the purpose, by the Customer in the manner indicated by Bank Of Baroda.
ii. Units purchased through Bank Of Baroda WMS Platform shall be redeemed through Bank Of Baroda WMS Platform, or in any other manner as may be acceptable to the Bank Of Baroda.

iii. The Customer is also responsible for the accuracy and authenticity of the instructions provided to Bank Of Baroda and the same shall be considered to be sufficient to operate / access the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform and/or avail/ effect Service(s) through the same.
iv. Bank Of Baroda has no liability or obligation to keep a record of the instructions of the Customer or for verifying the Customer's instructions.

v. Bank Of Baroda may refuse to act on any instruction unless they are given in a manner and form acceptable to Bank Of Baroda and in accordance with Bank Of Baroda's policy. However Bank Of Baroda shall have no responsibility to determine the authenticity of any instruction given or purported to be given by the Customer. Nor shall the Customer hold the Bank liable on account of bank acting in good faith on any of his/her instructions.

vi. Bank Of Baroda may refuse to comply with the instructions without assigning any reason and shall not be under any duty to assess the prudence or otherwise of any instruction and have the right to suspend the operations through the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform if it has reason to believe that Customer's instructions will lead or expose Bank Of Baroda to direct or indirect loss or may require an indemnity from the Customer before continuing to operate Bank Of Baroda WMS platform Service(s).

vii. Any instruction, order, direction, request entered using the recognized mode of verification and authentication of the Customer shall be deemed to be an instruction, order, directive, request received from him/her. All instructions, requests, directives, orders, directions, entered by the Customer, either electronically or otherwise are based upon the Customer's decisions or are the sole responsibility of the Customer.

viii. Bank Of Baroda may at its discretion not carry out my instructions where the bank has reasons to believe (which decision of the Bank I shall not question or dispute) that the instructions are not genuine or are otherwise improper or unclear or raise a doubt. Bank Of Baroda shall not be liable if any instructions are not carried out for any reasons whatsoever.

ix. Bank Of Baroda shall not be deemed to have received any instruction, direction, order or request electronically transmitted by the Customer until it confirms the receipt of such instruction, direction, order or request.

x. Bank Of Baroda needs to receive clear instructions from the Customer to induce the bank to effect fund transfer activities on his/her behalf. The Customers shall agree to indemnify Bank Of Baroda against any improper/fraudulent fund transfer instruction purported to be received from him/her. The Bank shall not be obliged to accept from the Customer any oral or facsimile instructions. The Customer shall acknowledge that the security and the control procedures provided by Bank Of Baroda are designed to verify the source the communication and not to detect errors in transmission or content including discrepancies between names and account numbers and that the Bank, or any intermediary, may execute an instruction by reference account number only, even if the name on the account is also provided. Nothing contain herein shall require Bank Of Baroda to violate any applicable laws, rules or the procedures/Instructions. Bank Of Baroda shall have no further duty to verify the content of any instruction and communications, whether or not authorised, sent in its name and accepted by Bank Of Baroda. Bank Of Baroda will process the transaction instruction as it is received and will not validate the same for holdings, correctness of transaction and any other information.

The Customer is responsible for the correctness of information supplied to Bank Of Baroda for access /use of the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform and/or availment of Services through any other means such as electronic mail or written communication. Bank Of Baroda accepts no liability for the consequences arising out of erroneous information supplied by the Customer. If the Customer notices an error in the information supplied to Bank Of Baroda either in the application form or any other communication, he shall immediately intimate Bank Of Baroda about the same and Bank Of Baroda shall endeavour to correct the error wherever possible on a reasonable efforts basis.

ii. Information about performance of the fund, risk return details etc. displayed on this Bank Of Baroda WMS platform are sourced from a third party and Bank Of Baroda is not responsible for the accuracy of this information. Bank Of Baroda cannot be held liable for any losses incurred due to reliance on such information.

Neither Bank Of Baroda nor its Affiliates shall be held responsible/liable for any unauthorized transactions occurring through the access / use of the Bank Of Baroda WMS platform and/or availment of Services and the Customer hereby fully indemnifies and holds Bank Of Baroda and the Affiliates harmless against any action, suit, proceeding initiated against it or any loss, cost or damage incurred by it as a result thereof.

vi. Bank Of Baroda cannot be held liable / responsible for any delay in crediting funds back to the Registered Account of the Customers for any transaction rejected by RTA/AMC.
